Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Father Jonathan Morris, Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church, 627 East 187th Street, Bronx, NY 10458.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Torres.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Jonathan Morris, Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church, 627 East 187th Street, Bronx, NY 10458.

Council Member Torres moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 14, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Miller.
Items.MinutesNote: The Speaker (Council Member Johnson) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 14, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor – Submitting Executive Order No. 31 of 2018 pursuant to Section 3-113(a)(2) of the New York City Administrative Code, regarding the creation of the Office of Nightlife within the Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment in accordance with Local Law No. 178 of 2017.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Executive Order No. 31 of 2018 - Regarding the creation of the Office of Nightlife within the Mayor’s Office of Media and Entertainment in accordance with LL 78 of 2017.

Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'18 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-6)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Items.MinutesNote:
During the Communication from the Speaker segment of this Meeting, the balcony was cleared of visitors after several disruptions broke out.


     After the Meeting resumed, the Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) assumed the chair as the Acting President Pro Tempore and Presiding Officer of these proceedings following the departure of the Public Advocate (Ms. James).

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the rent stabilization laws
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extending the rent stabilization laws.

Items.Title: Resolution determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2018.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his opposition to the passage of this item:
Council Member Matteo (Negative).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of NY continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2018.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Items.MatterName: Implementation of a tracking system for and a review of expiring  affordable housing units.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Requiring that bail bond agents make certain disclosures.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Improving young adults’ access to voter registration materials.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Alternate eligibility for designation or nomination of a candidate for an elected office of the city.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to post information regarding the process used in determining identified seat need.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).


There were 48 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Acting President Pro Tempore and Majority Leader  (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, April 11, 2018.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MatterName: Planning, 721 VAN SICLEN HDFC, Brooklyn (20185227 HAK)

Items.Title: Application No. C 20185228 HAM submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Section 577 of Article XI of the Private Housing Finance Law for approval of a new real property tax exemption for property located at Block 2130, Lot 44, Community District 12, Council District 10.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Planning, Dispositions and Concessions
Items.MatterName: Planning, 500 West 174th Street HDFC, Manhattan (20185228 HAM)

Items.Title: Application No. 20185148 HKX (N 180166 HKX) pursuant to Section 3020 of the New York City Charter, concerning the designation by the Landmarks Preservation Commission of the Samuel H. and Mary T. Booth House, 30 Centre Street (Block 5626, Lot 414), as an historic landmark, Borough of the Bronx, Community Board 10, Council District 13.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, Samuel H. and Mary T. Booth House, Bronx (20185148 HKX (N 180166 HKX))

Items.Title: Application No. C 170240 ZMK submitted by SP North of North Limited Partnership, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the zoning map, section no. 28d, changing a portion of the block bounded by Neptune Avenue, West 28th Street, Mermaid Avenue, and West 29th Street, from R5 and R5/C1-2 zoning districts to R5, R6, R6A and R7A/C2-4 zoning districts, Borough of Brooklyn, Community Board 13, Council District 47.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sea Park North Rezoning, Brooklyn. (C 170240 ZMK)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Acting President Pro Tempore and Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
